website_summaries.verdict: Some users question the value of "generic" DNA results, but the 23andMe system is designed to expand as more genetic information becomes available. Worth the additional investment.
pros: Ethnicity results very accurate, even out to several degrees of relationship
Adoptees will find useful information on birth families
Provides medical information other popular DNA kits do not
cons: Heritage and genetic information can be very broad, not specific to user
Does not test for many common disease markers

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted
customer_reviews.text: I had to submit DNA twice and both times they said it failed on their end. Then they stated I am NEVER allowed to try again in the future. I purchased kits for the entire family and linked everyone to my account. What a huge waste of time. Funny thing is, I did ancestry.com at the same time and that gave me results in under 3 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Ama_customer

customer_reviews.title: They don't respond, and my sample is being processed well over 2 months
customer_reviews.text: It has been 2 and a half months since they received the sample and nothing, and they have a FALSE advertisement of 6 to 8 weeks processing . I keep submitting tickets and they just keep closing them without doing anything. Useless support (I think outsourced in India, not sure about the accent). Anyway, if you want to spend $200 and send your DNA somewhere and get NO FEEDBACK about it this might be a good product for you.
customer_reviews.author: stevan

customer_reviews.title: No communication
customer_reviews.text: Packaging and saliva submission process was professional and comfortable but prepare to sit in “processing” status hearing nothing from the company for weeks on end.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Rea

customer_reviews.title: Buy the $99 Kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, but I would get the $99 kit over the $199 one. Then go to Promethease.com and dna.land.com and import your results (when their available from 23andMe), For $5.00 they give you loads of medical and other misc. insights from your genetic information. Importing is quick and easy, do it right from the Promethease website (links to 23andMe directly and grabs your data. dna.land requires you to upload data yourself). Just be sure to download a copy of the final results to your computer for future reference (as Promethease will automatically delete information from their servers after 4 months). DNA.LAND is free (it's a research project) well worth the extra effort and produces some more interesting results.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Tried to collect extra fees
customer_reviews.text: We have had nothing but problems with 23 and me with our purchase. To add to this they tried to get me to pay an extra lab fee to fix the problem they caused themselves. We finally got someone who looks like they will help, but we will see, a lot of time has been spent on this. I think the company may be in trouble or failing in some way, I am very concerned about our privacy as rumors are they are selling our data to third parties. I would avoid 23 if you are looking for a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: RBS

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a kit for a friend as a gift ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a kit for a friend as a gift. When my friend tried to register the kit, it kept saying "invalid barcode". After arguing with 23andme, they refused to replace the kit and kept saying it was already refunded (for a different amount than I paid and to a credit card with last 4 digits that I did not have). Nevertheless, 23andMe refuses to replace the kit and Amazon sold me a used kit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Bought it as a gift for my racist dad, apparently he isn't as much Caucasian as he thought he was!
customer_reviews.text: Best gift for Fathers day! But think ahead and buy it early enough so to get the results by Fathers day! My dad brags that our family is 100% Caucasian from Europe, he lives in Texas it' has been a dinner conversation since absolutely ever. I was fed up with all this so I asked him to get the test and 23 and me proved that he is by 1/5 Mexican! I'm wondering now if he still wants that border wall with Mexico! :D
customer_reviews.author: Mike.N

customer_reviews.title: SLOW - 2 Months Later And Still No Results!!
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to say this is a great test, but it's been two month now and still haven't received my results. It's been sitting at "DNA Extraction" for almost 8 weeks now! Ancestry and Family Tree DNA are much quicker!!
customer_reviews.author: JewelsOK

customer_reviews.title: Beware of questionable response reliability
customer_reviews.text: For $150 i received a kit. Sent in a sample 12/12/17. By 3/6/18- no notice of status, no reports. No response to request for status. "hate" seems a little strong as an assessment. Lets say I resent being played.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Things went great for my family members for whom the test worked
customer_reviews.text: Things went great for my family members for whom the test worked. In my case, the extraction step of the test failed twice. The only option at that point is to request a refund. Customer support in the refund process is flippant and rude at best. I don't expect to actually get my money back. This is, without question, the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I've had multiple help tickets asking for status updates get marked closed without acknowledgement. Phone support generally "can't hear you right now" when I ask questions about the refund. Then I get parked on hold, and then disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: James Clark

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed! I was really looking forward to finding out ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed! I was really looking forward to finding out more about my heritage and more information about my health and after two failed attempts they told me I could not submit another sample and that was that! This company I am sure works great for some people but it was a total wash and waste of time for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jamifrakes

customer_reviews.title: What a joke.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter who is adopted from China begged me to purchase this so she could learn about her genetics. Should have bought it at Christmas time when it was a lot less than the $199.00. She sent back her saliva and they said it did not contain enough DNA. I have been dealing with them for several months. Faxed them my drivers' lic. twice and they said they could not read it nor could they find any proof that I purchased the kit even though I sent them the Amazon receipt. They are still claiming they have no proof that I purchased the kit, but I could buy another one. My advice don't deal with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Jean D. Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you want to keep spending money...
customer_reviews.text: So you buy a kit. It's expensive, but hey, you're getting all of these tests and retorts, right? Nope. You get SOME tests. If you want ALL the tests, you have to spend more money. Also, while I had no issues with it, my brother's test failed, which seems to be a common issue here.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: the results are AWESOME and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband.. the results are AWESOME and he loves it. However, I am apparently married to a Neanderthal.
customer_reviews.author: R. Eugene

customer_reviews.title: You'll have to pay more $$$ for all reports
customer_reviews.text: They've turned health into health basic and if you want all reports you have to subscribe to an annual service. They used to be free. Not what I thought I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: This guy I know

customer_reviews.title: Use this before applying for colleges
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but I wish I knew I was 70% Native American when I applied to colleges.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed, I just orders a kit from ancestry
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a kit from ancestry for my daughter and one for me from 23and me , we sent the samples the same day on December 28, my daughter got her results February 3, I just now received an email (6 weeks later) saying that my sample didn’t have enough dna to conduct the testing . The email says they will send a new kit , I am very disappointed, I just orders a kit from ancestry , and will not recommend 23and me .
customer_reviews.author: steven josephs

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever!!! I bought this kit last Nov during Thanks Giving. It took them 2 months before failing to extract DNA from my saliva. Then there was a second try. I carefully followed the instructions. They spent another 2 months and failed again!!! After all, they offered a refund, but deducting shipping and handling fee! Totally wasted time and money!!! I bought unsatisfaying goods before, but never like this one. Won’t recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: WEI GUO

customer_reviews.title: The kit I bought does not include Health test as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The kit I've purchased states that it is "23andMe DNA Test - Health + Ancestry Personal Genetic Service". But on attempt to registered this kit on their website, I was notified that Health report is not included into this kit. Too bad - I bought it on sale yesterday (50% off), bit it vent that I've paid the actual price of simple Ancestry test (not with Health).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty unimpressed. Shocking
customer_reviews.text: Pretty unimpressed. Shocking, I have European heritage. The results were completely contrary to the obvious Results report unlikely to have curly or hair (I have both) or freckles (totally wrong); likely to be thin; likely to have green eyes (they asked my eye color and I reported GREEN). NOTHING exciting or interesting. No results except that my eyes will get worse with age. Don't waste your money unless you have NO idea where you're from.
customer_reviews.author: Daquarii J. Rock

customer_reviews.title: or this was the biggest wasted gift of the year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a friend. I'm out the money and she didn't get any results. Apparently they are sending another test kit out so she can try again. Hopefully that one works, or this was the biggest wasted gift of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before using
customer_reviews.text: My wife did this so we purchased another one. Unfortunately, 23&me lost the sample and when we contacted them for the results, they could not find a record of it. They said they would send another sample collection kit, but it has now been 4 months and no kit. So we spent $99 and no results. There is also no way to ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: William Pan

customer_reviews.title: Sloth in Zootopia
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the kit last Thanksgiving. Two months later they said there was not enough DNA in the sample and sent me a new kit. Now it has been stuck in DNA Extraction for more than a month. Still no results.
customer_reviews.author: Camedia

customer_reviews.title: Lost my sample....3 months and counting.....
customer_reviews.text: I got the kit, but repeated calls to 23andme to find out what happen to my results leads to nothing.....been in 1-3 day review since Sept 21 (its now middle of November) ......if they can't even keep track or actually find my sample, I have to question the quality of results or interpretation for something more complex like DNA analysis.
customer_reviews.author: Agrican

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible experience. They literally sent me no information at all. Never worked at all. Do Not Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: It's easy and fun
customer_reviews.text: It's easy and fun, but as a scientist, I can say that its interpretations of your genes are largely total bunk. If you want to seriously know about your genes, go to a real doctor. This is a cheaper way to get some idea of what's going on. Remember, you're giving this group the entirety of your genome that they will use for research and publications. If you're not okay with that, then this is not a product for you. If you get it, take the results with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: 2 months for results, and 2 out of 3 samples were lost
customer_reviews.text: ordered this for three family members. one took 2 months to get the results. for the other two, they waited 2 months to tell us the sample didn't work and they need to resend the kit. False advertising in stating you get the results in a few weeks and bungling 2 out of 3 samples is not a good batting average.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn mom

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with DNA results but the health DNA extra is ...
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied with DNA results but the health DNA extra is very little. Not what I expected. I just wish they would include a BRCA report. I would like to know if I carry the gene for breast cancer. I communicated with 23andMe and they told me the FDA won't allow any company to provide this report at this time. Why? It adds up to one thing - "Money." The FDA and the companies able to provide BRCA reports won't get kickbacks or reimbursement. Meanwhile millions of women could be helped by getting a BRCA result in a genetic profile kit like this. .
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Only tells you what regions of the world you're from ...
customer_reviews.text: Only tells you what regions of the world you're from if you provide that information to them. I'm eastern European with Mongolian looking eyes but I dont have any information on relatives from that region. Took this pricey test and now I still dont know why my eyes are different. Thanks so much for you help 23andme. Worthless curiosity bait
customer_reviews.author: Kyrylo Pashchenko

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!!...I received the 23 & Me kit today. Unfortunately, the box revealed a hidden US Postal return label. As far as I could make out, it was originally returned from Phoenix, Arizona. I have attached a pic where you can enlarge the pic and see where the return label is “hidden” under a thin, same-sized white label. (See attached pic) The 23&Me box was then shrink-wrapped and an “Ancestry & Health” sticker was adhered outside the shrink wrap to make it look unused(?) before shipping to me. I am returning this box with shrink wrap unopened ASAP!! $200 is too much money to be scammed with obviously a previously returned/possibly opened box!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Are they providing the results based on my answers to their questions or my saliva?
customer_reviews.text: It is like you are paying a lot of money and spending tons of time to provide all your information to receive your DNA data, based on your answers from their questions. I created an account followed by instructions , and had answer all these endless questions they are asking.. (which I think I am giving them my biological information already) and after couple of hours later, found myself still answering the questions, I just decided to stop and return this product.
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: So apparently I'm...
customer_reviews.text: So apparently I'm not adopted. I didn't think I was, but there was always that lingering doubt because I'm so different from the rest of my family. 99.9% european with .1% sub-african. Not sure if the health part - and paying extra for it - was worth it, but it had some interesting assumptions.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy b

customer_reviews.title: Not detailed with certain areas.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on black friday. Any other day it would have been too expensive for me. I got the results back a bit early, but was dissapointed with the results. Allow me to explain, I bought this because I thought it could give me detailed informtaion on my ethnicity. It just said, "Middle Eastern". I was aware I was Middle Eastern, but I wanted more specific countires rather than a genral area. My friend is Japanese and it said specifically Japanese, not just "East Asian". Can you see why I'm dissapointed?
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: No Results, No support
customer_reviews.text: Kit was a Christmas present. Sample sent in at the end of Dec. 2018, now it is April 19 2019, and no results. Customer support is crap. Unintelligible foreigners, asking for the same information, over and over. We have sent them all of the info requested, but they have been totally inept or disinterested. My only recourse at this point is to cost them some customers and perhaps save someone else from the loss and hassle that we have encountered. Don't purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobozr

customer_reviews.title: A Message From Chief Running Mouth
customer_reviews.text: It's official, I am significantly more American Indian than Elizabeth Warren! :D As such I have declared myself chief of the Wannabe Clan! Also I'm .3% black, so I feel entitled to reparations and whatever other minority privileges and perks I can get. On the medical end... eh... basically nothing. Apparently I'm genetically perfect as far as health... environmental factors tho... mmm... probably not so healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Non

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, though
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for my husband. However, I sent mine in the exact same time as him and they were unable to extract my DNA. The reason for the 3 star review is that they did not email or call to let me know this, they just let me wait for weeks and weeks. I had to call myself to find out what was going on. Fortunately, though, they did give me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Alei

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for primetime
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing and not worth the money. As a South Asian, this product didnt add much value for me. It seems like this is catered only for Caucasians. For example, ancestry report -heritage is 99% South Asian (what a shocker), health wise, most of the genetic traits are incorrect. And it didn't find anything interesting for genetic health risks even though my family has a history of them. And, all of the reports takes 3 months. You may find some value in 3rd party sites with raw data. As of this time, it seems like 23andme is not investing enough for the diverse population. It seems like a waste of money and I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: and knowing is half the battle...
customer_reviews.text: I can now put to rest my fantasies about being adopted by earth parents while having some cool super natural background. I'm super white European. And like .01% Native American. I'm guessing that's not enough to open my own casino.
customer_reviews.author: Doc K

customer_reviews.title: Awful customer service
customer_reviews.text: Evidently these tests expire which can compromise the sample. It’s never mentioned anywhere that they expire. I actually didn’t even notice the small expiration date written on the test until I was zooming into a picture later, after I’d sent it off. Customer service is awful. I’m positive they are trained to give you the run around in order to save the company the most money possible. They refuse to replace the test even though it was expired. I will never purchase these as a gift again. Nothing but trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn I. McGrew

customer_reviews.title: Two tests with 23andme and I'm African American in one and Ukranian in other HA-HA
customer_reviews.text: It's a worthlessness pice of garbage I know my ancestors bether then they can show with DNA test I got two DNA tests with 23andme and I registered with two different names and I answer questions the as different and I have different results for same person its waste of money if you say that you are black it will show that you African American and I'm white guy and other one I told them I'm Ukranian and it shows that I'm Ukranian
customer_reviews.author: Yaroslav

customer_reviews.title: Great for identifying health issues!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the health reports. I wanted to identify gene related vulnerabilities to diseases like dementia and cancer. For that it was great. It did tell me I have an apoe4 gene I inherited from one of my parents but never told me what the other one was. I am disappointed in that. I am participating in dementia related research through the app. For ancestry... it’s interesting, but isn’t as accurate as you’d expect or desire. Gives you a rough idea though, so good fit that. Ancestry.com would be more ideal for that if one were interested in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Dunetraveller

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the content. Doesn't give much more than general information about ancestors and what it does is flawed. We know for a fact my great great grand mother was Cherokee Indian and this didn't pick it up at all. It asks more questions than it answers. The answers you give help fill out their database. Wish I'd spent the money on Ancestry.com. Know several who have gotten much better information than I received.
customer_reviews.author: C. felix

customer_reviews.title: Not willing to refund for the kit that cannot be processed
customer_reviews.text: Out of three kits purchased: One kit worked on a firs try, one kit worked after two attempts, and one kit, used by my son, never worked. We are still trying to have a refund for the one that did not work. The seller is not responsive at all. Can Amazon help?
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Immediately impacted my health in a positive way
customer_reviews.text: Found out some critical information that absolutely revolutionized my diet and expectations of sleep and exercise. Tremendous positive and unexpected impact on general well-being with knowledge of simple and important details that made a big difference. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Momkat

customer_reviews.title: I learned I have more Neanderthal DNA than most people.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this product and service, I found a cousin I didn't know I had. In addition, I learned I have more Neanderthal DNA than most people. It explains a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B.

customer_reviews.title: They use YOU as a growing data base........
customer_reviews.text: Pleased that what they mentioned correlated with what I know about my family history but they really want you to answer a lotta questions to develop THEIR data base. Imo, not worth the $$ but I rather enjoyed learning I had more Neanderthal DNA than 81% of respondents ...but as you can see...the more respondents, the more the base changes...In 6 months I may have no Neanderthal DNA at all. Pshaw! However, if you are interested in distant potential relatives........ this may amuse and be worthwhile for some.
customer_reviews.author: murphy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Dont get your hopes up.
customer_reviews.text: They refunded me because they could not get DNA from my spit....
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time & money
customer_reviews.text: I did the Ancestry & Health test (but only wanted the health section) December 2018. It was recommended by Dr Ben Lynch of Dirty genes fame. It came back with 15 genetic markers not covered, apparently recently dropped by 23 & me. Dr Lynch has now updated his recommendation to Ancestry DNA & downgraded 23 & me because of this. Sadly I have to pay twice for the test kits from both companies and also pay twice to have the raw data analyzed. Don't bother with 23 & Me it will give you a very incomplete picture.
customer_reviews.author: Smudge

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your $$$$
customer_reviews.text: vague, several total misses, No back hair, no bald spot, etc HA wrong very wrong. Askes way too many questions. Felt like a neighbor reading tarot cards. this is the more expensive test. BIG waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: CCCAT

customer_reviews.title: Daughter tried to use but didn’t work twice!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter tried to use but didn’t work twice! My daughter is adopted so it was exciting but she was twice rejected😞
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and send in.
customer_reviews.text: You have to spit a.LOT of spit into a tube, which is fairly gross. Bit it was easy and the results came about when they said. I want to say 3 weeks. The app and online system keep you posted. Be careful of people reaching out to connect, you may be related, but they are strangers after all. Be sure to pay attention to how your sample and information is SHARED OUTSIDE OF GIVING YOUR RESULTS. Take time to read and protect your privacy when you create an account online and submit your sample. Like asking that your sample be destroyed after testing and not kept and potentially sold or shared in future.
customer_reviews.author: SheTriedIt

customer_reviews.title: Fast turn around! Interesting information.
customer_reviews.text: Really fast turn around time for results. We had a fun "heritage reveal" dinner.
customer_reviews.author: JodyLynKC

customer_reviews.title: Really frustrating
customer_reviews.text: After two kits it was deemed that they couldn't extract enough DNA from the two total teaspoons of saliva. Which I think is BS because you hear about DNA being extracted from straws and cigarette butts that contain a hundredth of the saliva that I provided. I would've given one star but I'm getting a refund so I'm giving it two stars. I was really excited to learn about myself but am now disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: not as useful as I thought
customer_reviews.text: I got my kit because I never knew my fathers side of medical history and the ONLINE data that came back did not help much and was in a poor format for my needs
customer_reviews.author: Brent H.

customer_reviews.title: 23andMe is for you.
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed. Other ancestry sites really cannot compare. Providing health information along with analyzing your maternal line (maternal and paternal if your male) really sets 23andme apart. Of course you can get the basic ancesty feature if that is your preference. If you have a grandparent submit their dna along with yours, you can see exactly what traits were passed to you. However, Ancestry.com has a bigger database if you prefer the genealogy aspect instead. I feel like ancestry.com is a site looking to keep you selling services. With 23andme your results focus on you. I'm a walking advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Matcha

customer_reviews.title: One Year Later
customer_reviews.text: I did the test a year ago. I think it was very accurate however that's about all I got out of it. Looking back the Health Predisposition option was a waste of money. The APP is OK but has yielded almost no progress since the day I got the test back. The beta family tree portion of the APP gave me wrong info and I spent a lot of time chasing rabbit trails that were the wrong clues. I also did the Ancestry kit and that coupled with a free subscription to their ancestry searches has yielded tons of info. I recommend Ancestry.
customer_reviews.author: Kikaby

customer_reviews.title: They sell your DNA!!!
customer_reviews.text: Selling our DNA results to big pharma is pretty unethical. Do not buy this product until this company rectifies their practices. I'm very unhappy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to learn about yourself
customer_reviews.text: I found the entire process relatively easy and well explained in the kit (collecting saliva, registering the kit, return box was ready to go). The results even came faster than expected. My ancestry results were not what I expected so it was very interesting to learn more. My only disappointment was regarding the BRCA tests in the health portion. I was not aware ahead of time they only test for the variant common among those of Ashkenazi Jewish decent, which is rare. That was one of the main reasons I went for the health version of the test so it was disappointing that I had not found that info prior to purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: angel99mm

customer_reviews.title: Was not impressed ....
customer_reviews.text: it's okay.. wasn't impressed with the results... says I'm related to over 1000 people five close and yet when I click to see who these people are nothing shows.. they just try and get you to buy a family member a kit yadda yadda yadda... my mother tried a different from ancestry .com and comparing hers to mine.. its so out there so wrong but its up to you ....
customer_reviews.author: Odie65

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to find family
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, spit in a bottle, ship it out with the included mailer and wait for your results. No issues with the product, everything went smoothly and before I knew it I getting to know my cousin that lives 7.000 Km away (4300 miles) that we had no idea that either of us existed. I would recommend this to anyone interested in genealogy or if you for some reason do not know much about your family. You might get a nice surprise.
customer_reviews.author: H.Thor

customer_reviews.title: Gimmicky, but still interesting
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to have access to this item at a significantly reduced cost, so that I could have not only my history but also the health markers. Found it interesting in general, and while I won't be reaching out to get to know strangers with my DNA, I was still happy to have the information.
customer_reviews.author: ljvirgo

customer_reviews.title: I like it enough to buy this one again
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 tests that included health and one for just the DNA relatives potion. I tested several family members hoping that I was not related (I was hoping to discover that I was adopted). Unfortunately, the test proved that I am related to these people but I refuse to claim them. Based upon these results, the test actually works but it didn't give me the truth that I was seeking.
customer_reviews.author: muzac dee

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: After one month and two test submissions they failed to determine DNA. Have been attempting to receive a refund without any success. After several days of complying with their instructions, I feel I'm dealing with a computer or illiterate individual(s). I believe I've been taken for $199.00. I read the positive product reviews and can only conclude they were written by the product PR division and not actual users. DO NOT BUY THE PRODUCT. Ancestry is the better option. I
customer_reviews.author: William H Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Company has incredibly poor customer service and product is essentially useless
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ‘promise’ of all it could provide but didn’t. I disliked the product and the company—both are terrible. Everything else is great! I sent in 2 samples only to be notified they need a third. What kind of company that is an industry leader sends a boiler plate email after having poorly handled the matter twice? Waste your time if you want to own this ‘product’. it is not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Already registered to someone else
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit and it had already been registered and had to be SENT BACK!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Leao

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed  - not accurate dna testing
customer_reviews.text: I gave vague answers to see what my results would be and ended up needing to take another test. Results took 3 weeks - the genetic traits were absolutely way off. I would recommend a different brand I’m “70% British or Irish” - my grandparents are Irish so I know more than what I was provided. I did another company’s test and the results were completely different and matched with first cousin. When I complained 23andMe asked for the other dna test and after receiving them responded both test were “northwest European” dna - basic vague testing with inaccurate results!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennywren

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to get results.
customer_reviews.text: I think that this is a really cool thing and it’s wonderful to see your family history and health reports. The only thing that really upsets me is that it is taking forever. I ordered this product on June 26, received the product on the 29th i believe and sent it in the same day. I am still waiting for my results to come back and it’s August 29th. That is a little ridiculous...
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very limited BRCA1 and BRCA2
customer_reviews.text: I primarily got this test because it said it tests for the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes. I just got my results and learned that they only test for 3 variants that are only common in people with Ashkenazi Jewish heritage, which I do not have. If I had known this, I would have only gone for the ancestry option. Many of their other health reports were way off as well. I feel it was a complete waste of money for me, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Roselark

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was fun to participate in this. I guess since this is science, I expected exact answers. The report stated that I "would not be likely" to have a couple of physical attributes that, I absolute have and that I did not possess any of the genetic heritage, that I know I have, after having an extensive genealogy done and I do posses 1/8 native American in my linage that did not show up. BUT, after all that being said, I would do this again, and it did provide some interesting information.
customer_reviews.author: Cindyhasitall

customer_reviews.title: Eye opening, if not shocking, and fun
customer_reviews.text: So most of us only know what our parents and grand parents tell us about our ancestry, and that may not always be what we expect. My husband has always believed himself to be descended from Aztec and Mayan peoples with no other mix. The results showed the majority of his ancestry to be Native American, descended from the regions of South American and Mexico. Aztec and Mayan areas. He also discovered small amounts of ancestry from the Iberian Peninsula. Mostly, this is a fun way to discover a bit about yourself. It came back really fast, considering everyone got one in the massive Black Friday sales.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Was unable to process my results
customer_reviews.text: They said they couldn't get results, so it was for naught. However, even if I could get results, I don't think I would do it again. Quite expensive for a novelty that has a hit-or-miss result, and kind of odd for us to give our dna to them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: It's been more than a month since they received it, and there's still no result.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even want to give a star I waited with my bf for our results it didn’t take too long but the results are extremely disappointing like it’s a joke it’s inaccurate they probably just go by all the questions they ask you I found nobody in my family don’t ever buy it I know some of my history and none was right it looked like my bfs but his said he was black lol all indications of a black guy he’s Indian it had nothing about Indian I’m Italian my moms said is and you can tell and it had nothing about that just stupid don’t buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t have enough DNA in my saliva??
customer_reviews.text: Not enough DNA to get test results in my full tube of saliva. I’m easily stressed, so now that I’ve received a replacement kit, I’m afraid to go through the weeks of wondering. What if it isn’t about my DNA, but rather that I have some dreadful heAlth condition and they’d rather stress me out with a “sorry not enough DNA” than tell me I have 6 weeks to live??!!?
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use and easy to understand results
customer_reviews.text: Love that I chose to use 23andme over the other ones. It's quick and easy to use. Instructions for spitting in the bikes provided are simple, I filled up and threw on mail. I received many updated on status of package arrival, notifications that it is being worked on and being worked on and lastly that I can now view the results. The results are simple to understand for someone who has never done a family tree or Gene study before. I appreciate the app user friendly set up, makes understanding easier. I am happy I went with 23andme, It is much easier than the ancestry.com one I purchased as a gift for my mother.
customer_reviews.author: tracie kling

customer_reviews.title: A bit expensive for what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted the health part advertise as included but never given results
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Iffy...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how I feel about this test? They advertise so good that it sucks you in but the end result was disappointing. Why are you asking me 100 million questions about my health when your supposed to tell me? I feel like they came up with a health report based on me completing so many questions. Also how reliable is the DNA results? I bought then as a deal and I feel like it’s a waste..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: black Friday success
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both 23&me and AncestryDNA during black Friday. 23&me delivered results an impressive 3 weeks ahead of AncestryDNA. While my results between the two companies were very similar, my 23&me report was much more detailed. For example, both companies told me my DNA had a large percent of Irish, Scottish, and British, but 23&me was able to pinpoint specific regions where my ancestors lived. Not only was this company quicker, with my results, it was more comprehensive. For this reason, I would recommend 23&me first.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie P.

customer_reviews.title: If your not looking for much you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the information that came back was confusing. I have know clue what it means and most people wouldn't unless you gave a background in the medical field. It takes 5-6 weeks to get the results. They could only specify I was of European descent nothing more then that and Europe is a BIG place. If your not looking for much you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: so much information!
customer_reviews.text: my intentions to use this were to find out if i was going have parkinson’s and to see what my actual ethnicity was. i’m not a carrier for parkinson’s, 34% french and german, 24% british and irish; and i met my biological father. that was a crazy experience. we’ve talked a few times, my mom and his time lines match up and he does remember her. we haven’t talked since the holidays so the story is to be continued.
customer_reviews.author: Britni Lang

customer_reviews.title: Misleading False advertising MILITARY, STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT refer friends or family. It is misleading/false advertising to get email addresses and hope people wont realize they are paying full price. 2 health and traits kit have to be purchased. One at full price and the second at 10 percent off. Does not tell you that until you check out. By then most people wont notice there paying full price. This new Valentine's day FREE shipping. It's already free at all the retailers. Emailed them. They know what they are doing. MILITARY STAY AWAY.!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ryan nakamura

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The test did not tell me somethings I was lead to think it would. I wanted to know risks for mental health issues like depression or anxiety. Then risks for heart disease and cancer. I felt I wasted my money on the test.
customer_reviews.author: pink

customer_reviews.title: Only worth it if you don't know your family history.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much told me that I am a white man. I bought a hand mirror for $1.99 that told me the same thing. It has also told me what my hair color, eye color, and weight is most likely to be. The mirror did the same thing. It has let me know that I do not carry the gene for some extremely rare diseases, but my family history also told me that. The biggest surprise is when they sent me the report that says, according to my DNA, that I am likely to enjoy chocolate or vanilla ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Alton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$ !!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kit for each of our kids as well as for myself & spouse for Christmas last year when the kits were on sale...EVERY BIT WORTH THE COST!!! 23 & Me Health & Ancestry DNA kit gives sooooo much more information than I could have ever expected!!! There's tons of info on personal random genetic make up & seems to be VERY PRECISE for each one of us! AMAZING!!! It's the gift that "keeps on giving" because our kids now have priceless health & genetic (as well as ancestry) information that they can pass on to their kids. We are VERY PLEASED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Penny F.

customer_reviews.title: Great. No surprises on the genetics nor health
customer_reviews.text: I had no need for this but was just curious. Didn't really tell me much. Spent >$130 to be told that I can smell asparagus pee. Great. No surprises on the genetics nor health.
customer_reviews.author: crakmunkey

customer_reviews.title: Provides more details than the others I tried
customer_reviews.text: I've done 3 of these kits. Ancestory.com, Tellmegen and 23 and me. The results were very similar to ancestory.com, so I'd say accuracy is great. 23 and me gives more details than ancestory.com or tellmegen on the ancestory side, but tellmegen was more detailed on the health side. 23 and me and ancestory.com both show you the people registered with them with matching DNA, but Tellmegen does not. Both 23 and me and ancestory.com allow you to build a family tree . Tellmegen does not. I'd say that 23 and me was the best because of the extra details they provide.
customer_reviews.author: sandi

customer_reviews.title: I was happy hubby was not
customer_reviews.text: The problem with these things is when you grow up your entire life connecting with a culture that you actually aren’t a part of. My husband was told his entire life he was Italian and Native American and he is neither! Mine however was very accurate and I like that the app connects you with your DNA relatives. I can’t wait to connect with my South American family!
customer_reviews.author: JanWicked

customer_reviews.title: My results shocked me!
customer_reviews.text: I have lived all my life thinking that I am mostly African American with a fair percentage of Native American. Oh, was I schocked when I got my results. At first I thought they sent me the wrong results. I am 49.7 percent European (Irish, Scottish, & UK), only 3% Native American, and 45% African American. The rest very small fractional percentages of other nationalities. It has not changed my life. I am still me! The same person I was before the results. It is all very interesting to see so many people I am related to.
customer_reviews.author: M. J.

customer_reviews.title: Registered to another name?
customer_reviews.text: I’m not comfortable using this kit as it came registered to another name. This is a man and I’m a female. Just seems a bit sketchy and I’ll be returning the kit to buy from their official website.
customer_reviews.author: V Fenty

customer_reviews.title: Unregistered Product
customer_reviews.text: very bad situation....23 says that Amazon sold us an unregistered product and therefore our submittal was trashed....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No bueno
customer_reviews.text: Totally bummed out. They could not analyze my sample on two separate attempts and would not try a third. I followed the instructions and did as directed. Was very curious to see the results but I guess I’ll have to try another company. 👎🏽
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 in 3 years

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to prove to her that I was not part idiot.
customer_reviews.author: Frank perri

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: Got my results after about a month of waiting. Very cool to know what your ancestry is (even though I am 100% European, it still told me which regions I am from and how much I get from each region). I would recommend uploading the raw data or importing it to Promethease for more detailed health analysis.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Landes

customer_reviews.title: Awecome
customer_reviews.text: My sample was received on December 22, 2018, and the results were ready for viewing on January 10, 2019. Gives you lots of in-depth information about where you came from. If your relatives also did this test, for example, a cousin, you can see what percentage of DNA you share with them.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanic815

customer_reviews.title: A fun test to take. Informative
customer_reviews.text: I told my wife, “less salad, more meat....I can feel my Neanderthal appetite on the rise”. Yep, fun to know I have 300+ Neanderthal variants in my blood. Now I have proof :) So, my loving wive sent me a raw steak for lunch that day, and asked me how I enjoyed my Neanderthal snack. Lol Seriously, lots of information given, and although I know my bloodline back a LONG ways, it was just confirmation.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed reading the multitude of reports provided about my ancestry ...
customer_reviews.text: Fascinating and eye opening results. Just be sure you want to know about your family history and exercise caution when you share results. My results had some surprises, which I was OK with. Other members of my family, not so much. This is a very thorough test. I have enjoyed reading the multitude of reports provided about my ancestry and potential health issues. Half price on Black Friday last year.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great until customer service thinks you stole your kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit over a year ago, submitted my sample, got my results, and everything was fine. Then I was contacted by 23andme customer service a YEAR after purchasing, saying someone reported my kit as being stolen, so they were freezing my account until I provided proof of purchase. Even after providing proof of purchase (through amazon) they continued to insist my kit was a stolen kit, and ultimately deleted my account. I then had to fight with them to get reimbursed my original purchase price. Then they wanted to send me a coupon to purchase another kit. I declined.
customer_reviews.author: CMA

customer_reviews.title: Expired! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas present for multiple of my children who live over 1,000 miles away knowing it's something they've wanted for a long time. Upon opening the package they've called me to say that the test kits are EXPIRED! Shocked by this they've begun to try and get replacement kits from 23 and me. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Finally the answer
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome... I recently received my results and the health part has finally solved a life long health issue. I would recommend anyone that has a undiagnosed illness.
customer_reviews.author: Aprille Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time and money.Ancestry DNA is better.Did not match with Ancestry DNA
customer_reviews.author: Mel Chandler

product_meta.title: 23andMe Health + Ancestry Service: Personal Genetic DNA Test Including Health Predispositions, Carrier Status, Wellness, and Trait Reports (Before You Buy See Important Test Info Below)
product_meta.description: Before Mailing, register your kit at 23andme.com/start otherwise, your sample will NOT be processed. ANCESTRY + TRAITS FEATURES Ancestry reports - 35+ reports including: Ancestry Composition, Ancestry Detail Reports, Maternal & Paternal Haplogroups, Neanderthal Ancestry, Your DNA Family - DNA Relative Finder: Find and connect with relatives in the 23andMe database who share DNA with you. (opt-in) - Family Tree: Automatically built from your DNA relationships. It’s easy. It’s convenient. It’s just a click away. Traits reports - 30+ traits including: Hair (Color, Curliness, Male Bald Spot), Taste & Smell (Sweet vs. Salty, Bitter), Facial Features (Cheek Dimples, Unibrow, Freckles) HEALTH FEATURES Health Predisposition reports* - 10+ reports including: Type 2 Diabetes (Powered by 23andMe Research), Late-Onset Alzheimer's Disease, Celiac Disease Carrier Status reports* - 40+ reports including: Cystic Fibrosis, Sickle Cell Anemia, Tay-Sachs Disease Wellness reports - 5+ reports including: Deep Sleep, Lactose Intolerance, Genetic Weight OTHER FEATURES Share, compare and discover more with friends and family - Trace DNA through your close family and explore the genetic similarities and differences between you and family members.
feature_bullets: Before purchasing, review important information at 23andme.com/test-info

HEALTH FEATURES: Know your genes. Own your health. Learn how genetics can influence your chances of developing certain health conditions. Find out if you’re a carrier for certain inherited conditions. Discover what your DNA has to say about your well-being and how it can influence certain lifestyle choices.*

ANCESTRY AND TRAITS FEATURES: Know your personal story in a whole new way. Discover your ancestry composition and where in the world your DNA is from across 2000+ regions. Automatically start your Family Tree using your DNA. See what your DNA might have to say about your taste and smell preferences. Discover how DNA can affect your ability to match a musical pitch or whether you hate the sound of chewing.

PRIVATE AND PROTECTED: Everyone deserves a secure, private place to explore and understand their genetics. Your data is encrypted, protected, and under your control. You decide what you want to learn and what you want to share. ○ Subject to 23andMe’s Terms of Service at 23andme.com/tos and Privacy Statement at 23andme.com/about/privacy

RESEARCH: Know you’re making a difference. When you opt in to participate in our research, you join forces with millions of people contributing to science. Your participation could help lead to discoveries that may one day make an impact on your own health, the health of your family, and people around the world.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
